programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jeff Brohm takes the helm at Louisville as the Cardinals visit the Yellow Jackets for an ACC game. Brohm went 36-34 from 2017-22 at Purdue. Georgia Tech's Brent Keys begins his first full year after replacing Geoff Collins last season and going 4-4.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College GameDay
programme.desc: Originating from the site of one of the day's best matchups, with a sea of fans cheering wildly in the background, host Rece Davis and analysts Lee Corso, Kirk Herbstreit and Desmond Howard talk college football for three hours, reporting on the top teams, games, players and storylines. David Pollack and Maria Taylor contribute reports, interviews and features. Davis replaced longtime host Chris Fowler in 2015.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 20 Sooners start their final season in the Big 12 by hosting the Red Wolves. Oklahoma sets sail for the SEC in 2024. The Sooners come off their first losing campaign since 1998. Oklahoma's Dillon Gabriel tossed 25 touchdown passes in 2022.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Tigers host the Minutemen. Auburn hired Hugh Freeze as the 31st head coach in program history Nov. 28, 2022. Auburn also lured quarterback Payton Thorne away from Michigan State. UMass won its 2023 opener 41-30 versus New Mexico State on Aug. 26.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jimbo Fisher leads his No. 23 Aggies squad against the Lobos. Fisher, who enters his sixth season with Texas A&M, is coming off his first losing campaign since 2017, his last year at Florida State. Texas A&M is 4-0 versus New Mexico since 2008.

programme.title: College Football Scoreboard
programme.desc: Presenting up-to-the-minute scores and highlights during the college football season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: UCLA kicks off its final campaign in the Pac-12 by playing Sun Belt side Coastal Carolina at the Rose Bowl. The Bruins will begin play in the Big Ten in 2024. Tim Beck takes over as head coach of the Chanticleers following a 9-4 season in 2022.

programme.title: SportsCenter
programme.desc: The latest news, highlights and inside information from every corner of the sports world is presented each day on "SportsCenter," ESPN's first-ever program when the network debuted in September of 1979. The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: College Football Final
programme.desc: Once the day's slate of college football games is complete, ESPN recaps the action and discusses its implications on the top 25. Matt Barrie hosts with analysts Jesse Palmer and Joey Galloway.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Jimbo Fisher leads his No. 23 Aggies squad against the Lobos. Fisher, who enters his sixth season with Texas A&M, is coming off his first losing campaign since 2017, his last year at Florida State. Texas A&M is 4-0 versus New Mexico since 2008.

programme.title: College Football

The flagship series airs an evening edition and a brand new midnight show each weekday before the stage is cleared for a live "SportsCenter" morning block that emphasizes fast-paced, highlights-driven reports and what's new on social media platforms.

programme.title: Formula 1: Grand Prix Sunday
programme.desc: Teams make final preparations for the day's race. Plus, interviews, features, and Martin Brundle's popular "grid walk."

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing
programme.desc: From Autodromo Nazionale Monza in Monza, Lombardy, Italy.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: Hard Rock Stadium in Miami hosts this SWAC matchup between Jackson State and Florida A&M. Last season, the Tigers routed the Rattlers 59-3 for a second consecutive season-opening victory. Jackson State pumped South Carolina State 37-7 on Aug. 26.

programme.title: Baseball Tonight: Sunday Night Countdown
programme.desc: Leading into each of ESPN's Sunday Night Baseball telecasts is this special edition of "Baseball Tonight." Host Karl Ravech teams with analysts and reporters to present fans a detailed preview of the network's exclusive, national game of the week. Highlights of the day's other games, interviews with players and managers, and key storylines from around the league also fill the hourlong show. Mark Teixeira, Eduardo Pérez, Tim Kurkjian and Buster Olney are among the analysts.

programme.title: MLB Baseball
programme.desc: The Astros put an end to their season series with the Yankees in a Sunday Night Baseball matchup. New York's Michael King hasn't allowed an earned run in his last two starts, and held Houston scoreless across a pair of relief appearances in August.

programme.title: SportsCenter With Scott Van Pelt
programme.desc: SVP's up at midnight and bringing his unique perspective on games people play to "SportsCenter" viewers. The hourlong, late-night show is driven by the host's self-deprecating wit and passion for sports, with featured elements, including Van Pelt's nightly "1 Big Thing" commentary and a weekly look back at the moments that drove bettors wild in "Bad Beats." The show also delivers what "SportsCenter" fans are used to -- news and highlights, guests and interviews -- but in a different, fast-paced and insightful way.

programme.title: Get Up
programme.desc: ESPN's morning show features host Mike Greenberg with a rotating and diverse group of analysts opining about and analyzing the latest news from the world of sports. The two-hour, personality-driven show originates from Manhattan's South Street Seaport, a locale that attracts high-profile guests. Greenberg, aka "Greeny," is formerly one-half of ESPN Radio's longtime "Mike & Mike" morning show.

programme.title: First Take
programme.desc: Stephen A. Smith joins host Molly Qerim on this weekday morning sports debate show. Smith provides his expert takes on the day's trending sports topics and under-the-radar news. They're regularly joined by veteran analysts and the top guests in sports and entertainment.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: College Football Countdown
programme.desc: A look at the day's college football action, featuring news, highlights and game previews.

programme.title: 2023 U.S. Open Tennis
programme.desc: From the USTA Billie Jean King National Tennis Center in Flushing, N.Y.

programme.title: NFL Live
programme.desc: Host Laura Rutledge takes the helm of this weekday show featuring the likes of Marcus Spears, Dan Orlovsky, Mina Kimes, and Adam Schefter. The "NFL Live" crew entertains fans while offering all the latest news and analysis from across the NFL.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: From AccorHotels Arena in Paris.

programme.title: Around the Horn
programme.desc: Hosted by Tony Reali in the ESPN studio and joined via satellite by four panelists from across the country, the team debates popular sports stories. Reali acts as moderator, giving points for well-made arguments and deducting points for those who inspire him to hit the "mute" button. At the end of the show, whomever Reali deems the winner has 30 seconds without interruption to voice their final opinions on any topic they want.

programme.title: Pardon the Interruption
programme.desc: The debate is the story in this fast-paced, half-hour series hosted by former Washington Post sportswriters Tony Kornheiser and Michael Wilbon. The pair engage in high-energy discussions, conduct interviews and often argue over topics not even related to sports. Other sports reporters appear as guests and offer opinions on the top stories of the day.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Features greatest moments from the UFC's vast library of fight footage.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: From AccorHotels Arena in Paris.

programme.title: UFC Live
programme.desc: Exclusive takes on the biggest news, stars, and stories from UFC.

programme.title: UFC Main Events
programme.desc: Showcasing the best fights from recent events, revealing backstories of the athletes and their mindsets.

programme.title: UFC Unleashed
programme.desc: Features greatest moments from the UFC's vast library of fight footage.

programme.title: Formula 1 Racing

programme.title: E60
programme.desc: Psychedelics may be the future of mental health treatment in sports. E60 follows a group of former athletes with a range of mental and physical conditions as they take part in a medical retreat involving psilocybin, aka Magic Mushrooms.

programme.desc: The Chippewas visit the Spartans. Junior quarterback Noah Kim takes over under center at Michigan State following Payton Thorne's departure. Kim's targets include freshman receiver Antonio Gates Jr., son of retired NFL tight end Antonio Gates.

programme.desc: Matt Rhule begins his attempt to resurrect the Cornhuskers as they visit the Golden Gophers for a Big Ten game. Rhule takes over a Nebraska program that has endured six consecutive losing campaigns. Minnesota has won four straight meetings.

programme.title: TMZ Sports
programme.desc: Gossip and exclusive stories about athletes' personal lives.

programme.title: TMZ Sports Weekend
programme.desc: Our news team constantly breaks exclusive stories featuring the biggest stars in sports.

programme.title: Big Noon Kickoff
programme.desc: Top college football games from the Big 12, Big Ten and Pac-12 conferences, beginning each Saturday with the brand-new Big Noon Kickoff pregame show on Fox.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The No. 25 Hawkeyes host the Aggies. Kirk Ferentz is 186-115 with Iowa as he enters his 25th season as head coach. Iowa welcomes transfer Cade McNamara, who quarterbacked Michigan to a Big Ten title and a College Football Playoff appearance in 2021.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: No. 19 Wisconsin hosts Buffalo. Wisconsin's offseason was dominated by change. Luke Fickell, who took over as full-time head coach in 2022, hired Phil Longo as offensive coordinator and landed star quarterback transfer Tanner Mordecai from SMU.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cougars play their first match as members of the Big 12 as they host the Roadrunners. After going 9-0 in Conference USA play last year, UTSA moved to the American Athletic Conference. Houston topped UTSA 37-35 in triple overtime last season.

programme.title: College Football
programme.desc: The Cougars begin their first season as a member of the Big 12 when they host the Bearkats. BYU competed as an independent for the last 12 years. Sam Houston State, the 2020 FCS champion, begins its first FBS campaign, as a Conference USA club.

programme.title: Fútbol Premier League
programme.desc: Jornada 4 de la Premier League 2023-24 desde el estadio Anfield. Liverpool recibe a Aston Villa. Los Villans se llevaron un punto de sus últimas cinco visitas de la Premier League al Anfield, en un empate 1-1 la temporada pasada.
